content.text: Show that
Shade the region corresponding to the set given below each Venn diagram
Given that \(P = \{p:\tan p = 1\) for \(0^{\circ}\leqslant p\leqslant 540^{\circ}\} ,\) find \(\mathrm{n}(P).\)
Solve the equation \(16^{3x - 2} = 8^{2x}\)
Given that \(\frac{\sqrt{\frac{4}{a^3b} - \frac{2}{5}}}{a^{- \frac{1}{3}b^5}} = a^p b^q\), find the value of \(p\) and of \(q\)
On the diagram above, sketch the curve \(y = 1 + 3 \sin 2x\) for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 180^{\circ}\)
On the diagram above, sketch the curve \(y = |1 + 3 \sin 2x|\) for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 180^{\circ}\)
Write down the number of solutions of the equation \(|1 + 3 \sin 2x| = 1\) for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 180^{\circ}\)
Show that the \(x\)-coordinate of \(A\) is 2
Show that the gradients of the two curves are equal at \(A\)
Find the equation of the tangent to the curves at \(A\)
The curves \(y = x^{2}\) and \(3y = - 2x^{2} + 20x - 20\) meet at the point \(A\)
The points \(A\) and \(B\) have coordinates \((- 2, 15)\) and \((3, 5)\) respectively. The perpendicular to
the line \(AB\) at the point \(A\) (\(-2, 15\)) crosses the \(y\)-axis at the point \(C\). Find the area of the triangle \(ABC\)

The matrices \(\mathbf{A}\), \(\mathbf{B}\) and \(\mathbf{C}\) are given by \(\mathbf{A} = \begin{pmatrix} 2 & 1 \\ 1 & 3 \\ 2 & 5 \end{pmatrix}\), \(\mathbf{B} = \begin{pmatrix} 2 & 1 & 3 & 4 \\ 1 & 5 & 6 & 7 \end{pmatrix}\)
and \(\mathbf{C} = \begin{pmatrix} 9 \\ 10 \end{pmatrix}\). Write down, but do not evaluate, matrix products which may be calculated
from the matrices \(\mathbf{A}\), \(\mathbf{B}\) and \(\mathbf{C}\)
Given that \(\mathbf{X} = \begin{pmatrix} 2 & 4 \\ 3 & 5 \end{pmatrix}\) and \(\mathbf{Y} = \begin{pmatrix} 2x & 3y \\ x & 4y \end{pmatrix}\), find the value of \(x\) and of \(y\) such that
Write down the velocity of the body as it passes through \(O\)
Find the value of \(t\) when the acceleration of the body is first equal to \(10 \text{ms}^{-2}\)
Find the value of \(s\) when \(t = 5\)

A body moves in a straight line such that, \(t\) s after passing through a fixed point \(O\), its displacement from \(O\) is \(s\) m. The velocity \(v\) ms\(^{- 1}\) of the body is such that \(v = 5\cos 4t\)
Find the value of \(a\)
Find the equation of the curve
A curve is such that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = a\mathrm{e}^{1 - x} - 3x^{2}\), where \(a\) is a constant. At the point (1, 4), the graph of the curve is 2
Find \(\int (7x + 8)^{\frac{1}{3}} \mathrm{d}x.\)
Hence evaluate \(\int_{0}^{8}(7x + 8)^{\frac{1}{3}}\mathrm{d}x.\)
Show that \(\mathrm{f}(x) = 2(x + a)^{2} + b\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are to be found
Hence, or otherwise, write down a suitable domain for f so that \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}\) exists
The function f is such that \(\mathrm{f}(x) = 2x^{2} - 8x + 5.\)
Write down the range of g and of \(\mathrm{h}^{-1}\)
On the axes below, sketch the graphs of \(y = \mathrm{g}(x)\) and \(y = \mathrm{g}^{-1}(x)\), showing the coordinates of any points where the curves meet the coordinate axes
Find the value of \(x\) for which \(\mathrm{gh}(x) = 85\)
The functions g and h are defined respectively by
Find the \(x\)-coordinates of the stationary points on the curve and determine the nature of each of these stationary points
Given that \(z = y^{2}\) and that \(z\) is increasing at the constant rate of 10 units per second, find the rate of change of \(y\) when \(x = 2\)
Hence find the rate of change of \(x\) when \(x = 2\)
The equation of a curve is \(y = (x - 1)(x^{2} - 6x + 2)\)
Show that the surface area \(A \mathrm{cm}^2\) of the cuboid is given by
Given that \(x\) can vary, find the dimensions of the cuboid when \(A\) is a minimum
Given that \(x\) increases from 2 to \(2 + p\), where \(p\) is small, find, in terms of \(p\), the corresponding approximate change in \(A\), stating whether this change is an increase or a decrease
The diagram shows a cuboid with a rectangular base of sides \(x\) cm and \(2x\) cm. The height of the cuboid is \(y\) cm and its volume is \(72\mathrm{cm}^3\)
Answer only **one** of the following two alternatives
